private_information: I know the available action schemas and the example plans provided by the user. Actions: paltry(object0,object1,object2), sip(object0,object1,object2), clip(object0,object1,object2), wretched(object0,object1,object2,object3), memory(object0,object1,object2), tightfisted(object0,object1,object2).

I understand that each action has explicit preconditions and effects expressed as atomic predicates such as hand(X), cats(Y), texture(Z), vase(A,B), next(A,B), sneeze(X), stupendous(X), collect(A,B), spring(X).
I hold the user's two provided initial condition sets, two goal sets, and a long proposed plan which interleaves these actions on many object tokens.
operator.goal: Analyze the provided actions and the proposed plan steps for applicability on the provided initial conditions and produce a stepwise state transition log and a concise mapping of action arguments to predicate changes.

private_information: I specialize in local precondition/effect verification and edge-case detection such as missing preconditions, conflicting effects in a single step, and name collisions in object references.
I will attempt to replay each plan step against the stated initial facts to detect any step that is inapplicable under the stated preconditions or produces inconsistent states.
verifier.goal: Check the plan steps for local applicability, list any step that cannot be applied given the stated initial conditions and derived facts at that point, and identify ambiguous object naming or mismatched predicate arities.

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency auditing and in removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, ad-hoc counters, post-hoc penalties, or assumed meta-predicates that mask causal failures.

I will search for and flag shortcuts like implicit quota tokens, retrospective corrections to state that are not accounted for by action effects, and any 'bookkeeping' predicates that appear to be used to hide real causal links.
auditor.goal: Produce a cleaned description of the domain where bookkeeping shortcuts are eliminated or annotated, and produce recommendations for replacing such shortcuts with explicit causal actions or constraints so a planner like FastDownwards can correctly reason about causal and temporal relationships.

private_information: I coordinate the other agents' analyses and integrate their outputs into a single coherent planning model.

My final output must be a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownwards planner. I must keep all agents' actions distinct and preserve argument naming so the planner can distinguish agent-sourced actions.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate operator, verifier, and auditor outputs to produce a complete FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and PDDL problem that captures the available actions, initial facts, and the final goal, resolving ambiguities and removing bookkeeping shortcuts as recommended by the auditor.

public_information: Action schemas and constraints: paltry requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1, next obj1 obj2; paltry makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false.
sip requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2, next obj1 obj2; sip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false.
clip requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, next obj0 obj2; clip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false.
wretched requires sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1, collect obj1 obj3, collect obj2 obj3; wretched makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false.
memory requires cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1; memory makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false.
tightfisted requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, vase obj0 obj1; tightfisted makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false.

Initial facts set A: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_9, next object_1 object_6, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_8, next object_14 object_8, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_10, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Goal A: next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_11.

Initial facts set B: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_6, next object_14 object_8, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_10, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Goal B: next object_12 object_10, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_9.

User provided an explicit plan interleaving wretched, clip, tightfisted, sip, memory, paltry steps across many object tokens intended to reach goal A and variations intended to reach goal B. The plan is available for replay and analysis.

Notes: predicates are all binary or unary as used above; object tokens are named object_0 through object_14 and additional numeric tokens used in collect facts; the domain must preserve action argument order and distinctions so actions remain distinct in the combined model.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst of action schemas and user plans. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a stepwise state transition log, a mapping from each planned action to the preconditions and effects it exercises, and highlight any missing information required to formalize the action schemas for a planner.
analyze.prompt: Agent operator context: You have the public information about action schemas, two initial fact sets A and B, two goals A and B, and the user's proposed plan. Produce a stepwise replay trace indicating for each plan step which preconditions hold at that point, what effects would be applied, and any assumptions required to make the step applicable. If information is missing, state the minimal assumptions explicitly.

check.system_prompt: You are an action applicability and consistency verifier. Do not emit PDDL. Use the operator analysis and the public facts to identify inapplicable steps, conflicting effects, ambiguous references, and cases where multiple actions would produce contradictory outcomes.
check.prompt: Agent verifier context: You receive the operator's stepwise replay. Validate each step against the declared preconditions and derived facts. Report the first step that is inapplicable if any, list conflicting effects, and produce a concise list of disambiguation recommendations (e.g., unify object names, require additional preconditions).

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal consistency auditor tasked with removing bookkeeping shortcuts and converting informal bookkeeping into explicit causal constructs. Do not emit PDDL. Identify quota tokens, ad-hoc retrospective corrections, post-hoc penalties, or predicates used only for bookkeeping and propose replacements with explicit actions or constraints suitable for forward planners.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor context: Using the operator analysis and verifier report, scan for bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit counters, retrospective state flips not justified by effects, and any predicates used to hide causal dependencies. For each shortcut found, propose a concrete modeling alternative (explicit actions or constraints), and produce a cleaned action description set ready for encoding into a planner.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownwards solver. You must integrate analyses and audits from other agents and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownwards. Keep agent actions distinct by preserving their names and argument positions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure no bookkeeping shortcuts remain and that all causal links are explicit and supported by action effects. Use only FastDownwards-compatible PDDL constructs.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator context: You receive the operator analysis, the verifier report, and the auditor report. Integrate their outputs to generate a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and problem that capture the cleaned action schemas, initial facts for one of the provided scenarios, and the corresponding goal. Resolve name ambiguities and ensure actions' preconditions and effects are complete. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
